Package cz.vse.java.messages.utils.future

Class MessageTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.vse.java.messages.utils.future.MessageTask
  • public class MessageTask
extends java.lang.Object

    The class of MessageTask is used to abstractly define the type of the instances.

    This class is sealing the IMessage implementing instance in an object containing more useful information about it's execution.

    These message tasks have specified time of expiration (for preventing the not executable message tasks), the receiver of the message and the message itself.

    Written for project "Connections2".
    Version:
    05. 04. 2020 .vse.java.messages.utils
    Author:
    Vojtěch Pavlů
    See Also:
    IMessage, MessageTaskContainer

      Constructors

      MessageTask​(IMessage message, EServiceType service, java.time.LocalDateTime expires)

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageTask

        public MessageTask​(IMessage message,
                   EServiceType service)

        Constructor defining the message, the receiver and the expiration is got from default static field of EXPIRATION (60 seconds in the future by default).

        Parameters:
        message - to be sent
        service - the receiver of the message

      • MessageTask

        public MessageTask​(IMessage message,
                   EServiceType service,
                   long seconds)

        Constructor defining the message, the receiver and the expiration by custom long value.

        The parameter of seconds has to be 1 at least, otherwise it returns IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        message - to be sent
        service - the receiver of the message
        seconds - time to stay not-expired. After this period of time, it get's expired won't be executed. At the same time, it stays waiting for it's execution, so it's not a good idea to set it to high values

      • MessageTask

        public MessageTask​(IMessage message,
                   EServiceType service,
                   java.time.LocalDateTime expires)

        Constructor of MessageTask defining the IMessage, the EServiceType (the receiver) and the actual time of expiration by LocalDateTime instance.

        Parameters:
        message - to be sent
        service - receiver of the message
        expires - time, when the MessageTask expires and won't be executed anymore

    • Method Detail

      • runTask

        public boolean runTask()

        Runns the task - if it is not expired, the connection with the receiver is checked for authentication state. When it passes these test and gets executed (the message gets sent), returns true. Otherwise it returns false.

        Returns:
        true, when gets successfully executed, otherwise it returns false.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method.

        The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of: 

         getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the object.

      • isExpired

      • setEXPIRATION

        public static void setEXPIRATION​(java.lang.Long EXPIRATION)

        Setter for the long-formed EXPIRATION variable.

        This does not update any of the task created before. This may affect the new created tasks only.

        Sets default expiration period of time in seconds. Only values greater than 1 are allowed.

        It's not recommended to use too great values, because non-executables will remain stored and will be checked everytime it passes through all the MessageTasks.

        At the same time, it should not be to little. When the message task is created and the message is prepared for sending, the message task will be classified as expired and won't be executed anymore.

        The best solution seems to be somewhere in range of 15 and 120, which means the message will stay stored and waiting for execution for 15 seconds up to two minutes. First bound is recommended for fast-running processes using fast devices, the other bound is for slower and lazier usage.

        Parameters:
        EXPIRATION - given long value to be set to the variable
        See Also:
        Long, MessageTask
